[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All hash functions] [Debug vs Release] Do debug_assert! statements at lines 29-30, 50-51, 71-72, 91-92, 144-145 get compiled out in release, allowing invalid states that debug builds would catch? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All hash functions] [Memory exhaustion] Can all 6 hash functions be called simultaneously with maximum-size inputs to cause aggregate memory exhaustion crashing validators? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All hash functions] [Side-channel resistance] Do any of the hash implementations leak information through timing, power consumption, or cache access patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All hash functions] [Panic propagation] If any underlying hash library panics, can it leave the Move VM in an inconsistent state or cause transaction processing to halt? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Dependencies] [Supply chain attack] Can malicious versions of siphasher, tiny_keccak, sha2, sha3, blake2_rfc, or ripemd crates be injected to compromise hash outputs across all validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Dependencies] [Version pinning] Are hash library versions strictly pinned to prevent automatic updates that could introduce non-determinism between validators on different update schedules? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Move VM integration] [Type argument handling] Can Move code call these functions with type arguments (generics) that the debug_assert!(_ty_args.is_empty()) would catch in debug but pass in release? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Move VM integration] [Argument count mismatch] Can Move bytecode be crafted to call hash functions with wrong argument counts that bypass the debug_assert!(args.len() == 1) checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Gas schedule import] [Import vulnerability] Can the import from aptos_gas_schedule::gas_params::natives::aptos_framework::* at line 4 be manipulated to inject incorrect gas constants? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [SafeNativeContext] [Context isolation] Can malicious Move code exploit SafeNativeContext to access other transactions' contexts or global state during hash execution? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Return value wrapping] [Value type safety] Can Value::u64() and Value::vector_u8() wrappers introduce type confusion if Move VM doesn't properly validate return types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [State commitment] [Merkle tree impact] If keccak256 or blake2b_256 are used in Merkle tree construction, can hash collisions cause state proof forgery enabling theft of funds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Address derivation] [Collision attack] Can attackers exploit RIPEMD-160's known weaknesses to generate address collisions, allowing them to claim ownership of other users' accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Transaction signatures] [Signature forgery] If any hash function is used in signature schemes, can preimage attacks allow attackers to forge valid transaction signatures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [Consensus messages] [Block ID manipulation] Can validators exploit hash collisions to create different blocks with identical block IDs, breaking consensus safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [State synchronization] [Proof verification] Can malicious validators provide fake state sync proofs by exploiting hash collisions in the Merkle proof verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All functions] [Algorithmic complexity] Can attackers find worst-case inputs for any hash algorithm that cause quadratic or exponential slowdown compared to average case? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All functions] [Gas price manipulation] If gas prices change but per-byte costs don't adjust proportionally, can attackers spam cheap hash operations to bloat blockchain state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All functions] [Cache pollution] Can repeated hashing of specific patterns cause CPU cache pollution that degrades overall validator performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [All functions] [Parallel execution] Can hash function calls from parallel transactions interfere with each other causing race conditions in shared CPU resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [native_sip_hash] [64-bit output] Since SipHash only produces 64-bit outputs, can birthday attacks find collisions with ~2^32 trials, making it unsuitable for security-critical applications? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [native_keccak256] [Ethereum compatibility] Does the Keccak256 implementation match Ethereum's exactly, or could incompatibilities break cross-chain bridge contracts? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [native_blake2b_256] [Parameterization] Can attackers abuse Blake2b's configurable parameters (salt, personalization) if Move code doesn't properly specify them? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [native_sha2_512] [Length extension] Can SHA2-512's vulnerability to length extension attacks be exploited if hash outputs are used improperly in authentication schemes? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/hash.rs] [native_sha3_512] [Sponge state] Can attackers exploit intermediate sponge states if SHA3 is used in streaming mode rather than one-shot hashing? (Low)
